There is little to no need for hiring ground transportation as there are over two dozen dining establishments along with a variety of shops and entertainment venues within a 3 block radius to which attendees can leisurely walk.  Or to explore the destination further take advantage of Punta Gorda’s Free Bike Loaner Program . Culinary Scene Whether it’s an upscale dining experience offered by Carmelo's Italian Ristorante or authentic Fish & Chips featured at the Celtic Ray, downtown Punta Gorda will surprise your palate with creative, talented chefs cooking up delectable dishes spanning an array of cuisines.  Can you beat Bobby Flay?  Chef Jeanie Roland, a five- time James Beard Foundation Best Chef of the South semi-finalist, did and you can sample her spectacular recipes at The Perfect Caper.  If seafood is what you’re craving, try the crab legs or sushi bar at Laishley Crab House which also features a private dining room capable of accommodating up to 150.  For smaller groups, several other downtown restaurants offer private dining as well including River City Grill and F.M. Don's. And save room for dessert so you can visit Harborwalk Scoops & Bites, ranked the #1 ice cream shop in the U.S. by TripAdvisor reviewers. Unique Attractions/Offsite Group Activities Regardless of your purpose for visiting the Charlotte Harbor Event & Conference Center, there is a myriad of unique attractions that can be experienced as part of a group activity or during your individual free time.  For casual networking consider a golf outing at one of our highly rated courses such as Riverwood Golf Club, recently ranked the #15 course in the entire state of Florida. Discover the Peace River Botanical & Sculpture Gardens or the Visual Arts Center can customize a group workshop offering an art medium of your choice.  Interested in something a little more passive?  Punta Gorda is home to Peace River Wildlife Center, the Military Heritage Museum and the Vietnam Memorial of Southwest Florida…or check the event schedule to see what festival or activity may be occurring at Laishley Park or Gilchrist Park.  Also, just a mile down the road is the must-see Fishermen’s Village which has something for everyone:  over 30 specialty/boutique shops, a variety of sightseeing cruises as well as fishing charters through King Fisher Fleet, boat/jet ski/kayak rentals, four restaurants, live entertainment and the above-mentioned Military Heritage Museum. Bragging Rights What makes Punta Gorda the perfect meeting spot?  Here are just a few things that separate us from the competition: #1 Place in the World for Tarpon Fishing—Sport Fishing Magazine 3rd Best Place in America to Live & Play Golf—Golf Digest Top Ten Places to Sail in the U.S.—SAIL Magazine 2014 Best Spring Training Venue—USA Today 2nd Safest City in Florida—Background Checks.org One of the Best Healthy Places to Retire—US News & World Report Learn More Need more general information about the destination or assistance in bringing your meeting, conference or other event to the area?  Contact the Charlotte Harbor Visitor & Convention Bureau at 941-743-1900 or visit www.pureflorida.com . Come. Upon its opening in January of 2009 the Charlotte Harbor Event and Conference Center has hosted small meetings, large galas, sporting events, concerts, expos and just about anything else you can think of. For a facility that is just over 44,000 square feet, it stays very busy. We have a small dedicated staff that feels that every event, no matter how small or large, deserves the same amount of support and attention. We are an ideal location for those events that don’t want to get lost in a large expansive facility as well as those smaller local events, that at one time had to go to a larger city, we can now cater to you in your own backyard. We believe in partnering with you, our customer, to make your event the most memorable that it can be. We listen to your comments and needs, and strive to make your event as worry-free as possible and to exceed your expectations. A small example of what the Charlotte Harbor Event and Conference Center has to offer: 240 FREE parking spaces on site 7 flexible meeting spaces 1000 person dining capacity; 1800 general session capacity Close proximity to I-75 and US-41 (Tamiami Trail) High speed internet access and Free Wi-Fi throughout the facility 11 theatrical line-sets in main meeting space along with diverse in-house audio-visual services Exclusive food & beverage services provided by Savor…Charlotte Harbor 2 Loading docks and ramp provide easy-load-in and load-out ADA accessibility of Transcript Charlotte Harbor Event & Conference Center Community Contact Us Employment Opportunities Legends Global Charlotte County Facility Rules Home | Events | Plan Your Event | About Us | Contact | Site Map | Privacy Policy | Cookie Preferences | Do Not Sell or Share My Info 941.833.5444 75 Taylor Street, Punta Gorda, FL 33950 clare.riggs@charlottecountyfl.gov EMAIL SIGNUP Sign up for email updates from Charlotte Harbor Event & Conference Center Email Get Updates Copyright ©2025, Charlotte Harbor Event & Conference Center. The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Workforce Development Providers Council (WPC) is comprised of 15 organizations that serve job seekers and businesses in the Charlotte-Mecklenburg area. The WPC is an advisory committee to the Charlotte Works Workforce Development Board that provides leadership for local workforce development efforts and collaborates to develop talent, respond to business needs and ultimately increase economic opportunity. The names of our WPC partners are featured on this page. To learn more about the WPC and how it supports our Talent Source Network (TSN), click here .
